@graph.text: What type of cheese do you like on garlic bread?

headline: Best-Ever Garlic Bread
name: Best-Ever Garlic Bread
recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 425° and line a large baking sheet with foil. Make garlic compound butter: In a small bowl, mix softened butter with garlic, salt, and parsley until well combined. Spread cut sides of bread liberally with garlic butter. Sprinkle with Parmesan. Bake until bread is toasty and golden at the edges, about 10 minutes.

video.description: This buttery, garlickly bread is a classic for a reason. Serve it alongside a pasta dinner.
video.name: Parmesan Garlic Bread Will Disappear In Seconds

review.reviewBody: Make sure not to use 1/2 a teaspoon of salt. It’s way to salty. Just use 1/4 teaspoon

Absolutely Awesome!
I saw the recipe and had to make it.  I softened the butter in the microwave and mixed everything up in the same pyrex measuring cup.  I substituted dehydrated parsley, and let it rest in the butter for awhile before I spread it.  The garlic smelled very strong while cooking.  My wife is not a huge parmesan fan so I used about a tablespoon of grated.  It all came together beautifully.  There is no substitute for fresh garlic instead of powders and salts.  We only ate half of it for dinner.  We are going to put shredded mozzarella on the other half and put it under the broiler for a late night date night snack.  Enjoy!
Everyone loved this garlic bread. I would either reduce the kosher salt or eliminate it entirely. The parmesan cheese added enough salty flavor to the mix for our taste.
AMAZING!  I will only make it this way from now on! No parsley so I added sprinkles of oregano. Used squeezable minced garlic too.

Amazing!  I made it and my family loved it!!!  Nice and crispy and very tasty.  I replaced the salt with Adobo Seasoning and I also added onion powder and the dry chopped onion flakes.  Add a good amount of parmasan cheese!  I basically did the seasonings without the measurements, I just like to go my own way until I know it's a good amount for flavor.  Seasonings is key! :)
5 stars. I’m speechless, this is delicious.
I made this recipe for the first time for my husband and 5 year old son. We absolutely LOVED it and couldn't get enough. This recipe is DEFINITELY a keeper. Thanks for sharing this recipe:)
Great recipe I did use dried Parsley and roasted garlic. Will make again.
Good. I liked it with 1/2tsp of salt. Made a homemade french loaf, so it needed extra seasoning
My family really enjoys this garlic bread!
My sister made this exact recipe and it was sooooooooo good! I totally recommend it.
I was looking for a side to chilled cucumber soup, and I think I've found it!!! Going to serve with the soup and I'm putting avacado on the bread. Haven't tryed it yet but I'm excited!!!
Delish. I added shredded Parmesan on top for a cheesier approach. I also agree the 1/2 tsp of salt is a little much especially if you use salted butter.
This was absolutely delish (get it) and it was gone within minutes. I reduced the salt to 1/4 of a cup and it was delicious. (I would also put extra parm on for extra flavor)
This is the best garlic bread we've ever had and its now our go-to recipe! This is the only garlic bread we'll ever make for now on. It's simply the best!

I've made this several times now and it is way better than anything I pay more for in the frozen department at the grocery store.  I'm saving money, avoiding artificial ingredients and enjoying the flavors and textures of fresh made garlic bread. My entire family is happy!

description: The secret to really good garlic bread is to keep it simple. And to use a lot of garlic—4 cloves for one loaf! This recipe is the perfect side for our Spaghetti Bolognese﻿...or really any Italian pasta dinner﻿.
keywords: best garlic bread, easy garlic bread, garlicky bread, rich garlic bread, parmesan garlic bread, garlic toast, garlic butter, compound butter, parsley butter, garlic parsley butter
